- We are a 615,000 people
organization globally,
serving all the verticals.

So to ensure that the talent
is available across the globe,

across industry, training is
a very, very core component
of our business value prop.
Our philosophy towards the training
is based on the customer needs.
So it's important that we look
at what the customer needs are

and use some of the programs,
like AWS Skill Builder,
to address the account-specific needs.

We have that opportunity
to alter the training
based on the need.

I think that's where I
see the maximum value
from the Skill builder.
We have done multiple programs,

you know, not only beyond
Skill Builder as well,

leading to a significant
certification of Boost.
I'm extremely proud of the fact
that 35% of our workforce is women,
you know, with 156 nationalities in fact.
And we partner with AWS re/Start
in enabling quicker return to work
for the woman coming back from the break.

AWS Academy actually helped
us look at entry-level talent,

and we got the entry-level
talent AWS certifications.
So that actually helped us significantly
to make them productive for a customer
without too much of a lead time.
We have more than 25,000 certified people,

and in last three quarters,
we hit the 5,000 per quarter.

I think value of these
training and training programs

is especially getting
trained on the new areas,
and we proactively identify,
and driving that has resulted in
one of the fastest growing cloud business,
